tool.name: measureGastruloids
tool.description: Use macro from BIOP/Pierre Osteil to measure gastruloids.
tool.command:
#import re
mkdir input && mkdir output && #for file in $input_format.input #set identifier = re.sub('[^\s\w\-]', '_', str($file.element_identifier)) ln -s '$file' input/${identifier}.${input_format.file_type} && #end for ImageJ-ilastik --ij2 --headless --console --run '$__tool_directory__/'Area_measure_for_OMERO.groovy 'input_directory="input/",output_directory="output/",suffix="${input_format.file_type}",ilastik_project="${ilastik_project}",radius_GB="${radius_GB}",probability_threshold="${probability_threshold}",min_size_particle="${min_size_particle}",minimum_diameter="${minimum_diameter}",closeness_tolerance="${closeness_tolerance}",min_similarity="${min_similarity}",debug="${debug}"' > output.log && bash '$__tool_directory__/'combine_csv.sh @TOOL_VERSION@ $summary_results ".${input_format.file_type}"

param.name: closeness_tolerance
param.label: Closeness Tolerance for the spine
param.help: Maximum distance between circles along the spine

param.name: min_similarity
param.label: Min similarity for the spine
param.help: Close to 0 values allow more U shapes while close to 1 values only allows I shapes

param.name: debug
param.label: Debug the elongation index
param.help: This will output all inscribed circles
